text: Ian Ward (1929-2006), was a male former athlete who competed for England. ==Early life and education== Ward was educated at Hutton Grammar School before earning a teaching certificate in physical education at Loughborough College. He then obtained a master's degree's at the University of Leeds, a Graduate Fellowship at University of North Carolina and a PhD from the University of Liverpool. He played rugby for Preston Grasshoppers R.F.C.. ==Athletics career== He represented England in the pole vault at the 1958 British Empire and Commonwealth Games in Cardiff, Wales. ==Personal life== His father Frank Ward played football for Preston North End F.C.. ==References== Category:1929 births Category:2006 deaths Category:English male pole vaulters Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 1958 British Empire and Commonwealth Games
